title: Ticket #3205: PERSISTENT_AD_LOG not implemented
description:
> The documentation ... refers to PERSISTENT_AD_LOG but this did not > work. I found the COLLECTOR_PERSISTENT_AD_LOG in the source code and > it appears to do the same thing as PERSISTENT_AD_LOG so I guess it is > the same. The OFFLINE_LOG parameter also works but as the > documentation says it is deprecated ....

PERSISTENT_AD_LOG sounds like a better name to me, so I'm filing this as a code bug rather than a documentation bug.

[Notifying ToddT since this is his code and I'd like to hear what he thinks.]
remarks:
2012-Nov-19 14:37:42 by tannenba:
There is no 'right' answer here. The knob as currently implemented follows the convention of including the daemon name if only one daemon uses the knob. Thus my vote is we leave the code as-is.

2012-Nov-19 14:53:36 by tlmiller:
Shouldn't this go into docpending, then? PERSISTENT_AD_LOG is mentioned all over in the manual.

2012-Dec-04 14:08:48 by smoler:
The implementation uses the configuration variable name COLLECTOR_PERSISTENT_AD_LOG, and not what was documented (PERSISTENT_AD_LOG). So the documentation task is to change the variable name throughout the 7.8 manual.
check_ins: 2012-Dec-04 14:24   Check-in [34265]: Correct incorrect name of config knob ===GT=== #3205 (By Karen Miller )
creator: tlmiller
